content.heading: Specialized Education Unit
content.intro: We offer specialized education and training services within international programs designed for individuals with special needs. The focus is on :

columns.title: Skill Development Aspect
columns.description: Focused training in cognitive, motor, self-care, communication, and social interaction skills. Students benefit from the ABLLS-R (Assessment of Basic Language and Learning Skills â€“ Revised) and structured classroom environments guided by the TEACCH program.

columns.title: Academic Aspect
columns.description: Students in this unit follow the special education certificate, which adheres to standards lower than the age-based (ministerial) levels. Programs are adapted to their abilities and needs, with alternative assessments conducted across all subjects.

columns.title: Therapeutic Medical Rehabilitation
columns.description: Rehabilitation services are provided based on individual needs, including occupational therapy, physical therapy, and speech & language therapy, ensuring comprehensive support for every student.
